MS-13 is in the news because they are a useful boogeyman for Trump's efforts to paint immigrants generally as criminals. They help justify deportation policies which target their victims far more than the gang itself.

MS-13 is in the news not for the threat they pose but because Trump wants them in the news, and they make good copy. They are perceived as foreign though not really, they have crazy tattoos, and they use lurid violence to make up for their relative small potatoes status.

Anyone who says the Bandidos might not be worthy of nationwide hysteria would be chastised for ignoring the tragedy of their crimes. Look at how bloody that Texas shootout was. These bikers are animals.
Anyone who says the Bandidos are not an active threat has their head in the sand. As recently as March, a leader was tried for murdering a Hells Angel. https://t.co/wpQ8C2jRn9

As evidence, we could point to certain high profile cases. The Bandidos were involved in this horrific shootout in Texas in 2015 that left 9 dead. They can point to international ties: they have chapters in 22 countries. https://t.co/F2qtXwBzyc
As a thought experiment, imagine if Trump said, instead, that the biggest national security threat to the US was the Bandidos outlaw motorcycle club.

The very fact that Trump makes a big deal about the gang drives headlines, which inflates the perceived scope of their activities. Now, unlike for every homicide in Chicago or New Orleans, every killing linked to MS-13 gets a news article for the crime, arrest, and sentencing.

To make the case, against all evidence, that MS-13 is the biggest national security threat since al Qaeda, the Trump admin recounts the most salacious details of individual murders, whose victims are, incidentally, the same communities which Trump is denying TPS and deporting.

MS-13 is not nearly as well organized as Mexican cartels, doesn’t make nearly as much money as the Russian mob, and lives hand to mouth primarily through extortion. Its members are mostly teenagers. It targets members of their own community, and especially fellow gang members.
In the same period, there were at least 1,875 homicides as a result of mass shootings.

In terms of violent criminal activity, their activities drive lurid headlines but not overall crime rates. According to one estimate, there were 207 homicides linked to MS-13 members since 2012. That is out of 76,472 homicides nationwide for that period, or 0.3%.

It bears repeating: unlike in Central America, in the US, MS-13 is a relatively small player in the world of gangs & organized crime. MS makes up less than 1% of all US gang members based on FBI estimates. It is smaller than the Crips, Bloods, Latin Kings, and Aryan Brotherhood.
